data.title: Why do people remember saladin?
data.meta_description:
Saladin is remembered for commanding the Ayyubids at the Battle
of Hattin, in which the Ayyubids decisively defeated the Kingdom of
Jerusalem. The battle occurred on July 4, 1187.
data.text:
Saladin is remembered for commanding the Ayyubids at the Battle of Hattin, in which the Ayyubids decisively defeated the Kingdom of Jerusalem. The battle occurred on July 4, 1187.

What does the Egyptian flag symbolize?

The colors of the Egyptian flag symbolize the struggle of the nation against tyranny and the strength of the people of Egypt. The flag has three horizontal stripes that are red, white and black. It also has an emblem of the eagle of Saladin on it.

What does it mean when people say your elevens are up?

It is a reference to Mel Brook's movie "life stinks" I do not remember exactly, but I remember it from there.

Why do so many answers seem to come from completely clueless people?

If you want to put an answer and you say "You can't trust other people." how can they trust you? We are all humans, so lets make some peace by trusting other people and yourself. Remember that. -- Because a lot of people are clueless or otherwise stupid. Remember, the average IQ is about 100.
